Package p4_group_8_repo

Class GameScene

java.lang.Object
p4_group_8_repo.GameScene
public class GameScene
extends Object
This class provides the Game with animation, and handles user's game level throughout the game
Author:
Liew Yih Seng

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    User user
    Represents the user in the Game Scene

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GameScene()
    A sole constructor for constructing the GameScene class that displays obstacles, animations and user's information throughout gameplay.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void createTimer()
    This method creates a local timer by calling method AnimationTimer() within the GameScene that handles the change of user's score, the time when users has finished the level and when the entire game completes(level 10).
    void displayLevel()
    This method displays the most current level of the user within the Game Scene within a frame by invoking the frame constructor from class Frame.
    void displayMenuButton()
    This method displays a button on the top left corner of the Game Scene, where users can press it to either pause the game, view the highscore list or to quit the current game back to the Start Scene.
    void displayScore()
    This method sets the initial score to zero then displays them on the Game Scene within a frame by invoking the frame constructor from class Frame.
    void displayUsername​(String name)
    This method displays the username of the user within the Game Scene within a frame by invoking the frame constructor from class Frame.
    MyStage getBackground()
    Gets the background in the Game Scene
    javafx.scene.layout.Pane getScene()
    Gets the Game Scene
    void setBackground​(MyStage background)
    Sets the background of the Game Scene
    void setNumber​(int n)
    This method handles the display of score in createTimer(), where it will iteratively loop through the current user score then assign each figures into the array of score then display the most updated user's score on the Game Scene.
    void start()
    This method handles the start of background music and game timer.
    void stop()
    This method stops the local timer within the GameScene by invoking stop method from AnimationTimer().
    void stopGame​(MyStage background)
    Handles the stopping for background media by calling method MyStage.stopMusic(), stopping timer from World Class by calling method World.stop() and stopping timer from GameScene by invoking stop().

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • user

      public User user
      Represents the user in the Game Scene

  • Constructor Details

    • GameScene

      public GameScene()
      A sole constructor for constructing the GameScene class that displays obstacles, animations and user's information throughout gameplay.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      This method handles the start of background music and game timer. The background music has been called into this class by the MyStage.playMusic().

    • createTimer

      public void createTimer()
      This method creates a local timer by calling method AnimationTimer() within the GameScene that handles the change of user's score, the time when users has finished the level and when the entire game completes(level 10). Within the handle function, there existed several if conditions that triggers specific functions. The first if condition will test if the user's score has changed by using method Animal.changeScore() as it will return true representing an update to the user's score is needed. The second if statement tests the case when the current level will stop by using method Animal.getStop(int) as it will return a boolean after making comparison with the user's level. The third if statement test if the user has exceeded the max level that is level 10 by using the method User.getLevel() that returns the current level of users. If the comparison is true, End Game Scene will be triggered.

    • stopGame

      public void stopGame​(MyStage background)
      Handles the stopping for background media by calling method MyStage.stopMusic(), stopping timer from World Class by calling method World.stop() and stopping timer from GameScene by invoking stop().
      Parameters:
      background - A MyStage that represents the stage that holds the scene.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      This method stops the local timer within the GameScene by invoking stop method from AnimationTimer().

    • displayScore

      public void displayScore()
      This method sets the initial score to zero then displays them on the Game Scene within a frame by invoking the frame constructor from class Frame. The score being displayed will be in the form of an array where each element in the score array has been displayed by constructing the Character constructor from class Character.

    • displayLevel

      public void displayLevel()
      This method displays the most current level of the user within the Game Scene within a frame by invoking the frame constructor from class Frame. The level will be displayed in the frame by invoking the constructor from Character class which handles the display of character in the frame.

    • displayUsername

      public void displayUsername​(String name)
      This method displays the username of the user within the Game Scene within a frame by invoking the frame constructor from class Frame. The username will be displayed in the frame by invoking the constructor from Character class which handles the display of character in the frame.
      Parameters:
      name - A string that represents the name of the user.

    • displayMenuButton

      public void displayMenuButton()
      This method displays a button on the top left corner of the Game Scene, where users can press it to either pause the game, view the highscore list or to quit the current game back to the Start Scene.

    • setNumber

      public void setNumber​(int n)
      This method handles the display of score in createTimer(), where it will iteratively loop through the current user score then assign each figures into the array of score then display the most updated user's score on the Game Scene.
      Parameters:
      n - An integer representing the current score of the user.

    • getScene

      public javafx.scene.layout.Pane getScene()
      Gets the Game Scene
      Returns:
      The Game Scene

    • getBackground

      public MyStage getBackground()
      Gets the background in the Game Scene
      Returns:
      The background of the Game Scene

    • setBackground

      public void setBackground​(MyStage background)
      Sets the background of the Game Scene
      Parameters:
      background - A MyStage that represents the background
